text: Camera powers up, jostles around until it settles on -- The floor of a third world bus. Middle Eastern legs, traditional Arabian dresses to the floor, homemade bags, animals everywhere. A chaotic scene with men, women, chil all shouting in Farsi. Brief glimpses of a mountainous landscape through the shaky windows. This bus could reall use some new shocks and a better muffler. The camera rises, turns around revealing its operator, a WOMAN wearing a hajib (a traditional Arabian headdress). slumps low in her seat for privacy, looks around cautious and carefully lowers her veil revealing -- SCARLETT DURANG, mid 20s, an adventurous British archaeologist. The kind of cat that gets killed by curios Her off-the-charts intellect and multiple post-grad degre are barely concealed by her striking good looks and punk inclinations. Judging from the cloth that edges frame, she is obviously shooting with a small camera attached to her hajib. She whispers to the camera - alert, but not scared.

I'm approximately 20 miles inside the Iranian border en route to the Habala region where they have ordered the destruction of a network of caves at sundown tonight. I believe these caves might contain a critical missing piece of our history. A piece I can’t let them destroy. She turns the camera back around, then pauses and goes ba to her face. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Oh, and if I’m found dead, please know I entered the country of my own free will, fully knowing the penalty for trespassing here is burial up to your neck in sand and having a rock wall pushed on top of you. Which, you know, seems perfectly appropriate. She grins mischievously.  SCARLETT (CONT’D) But they’1l have to catch me first.

Sun is almost touching the horizon. The camera shakes as Scarlett crosses through a sparsely populated marketplace as megaphones in the background dem everyone clear the area. Scarlett is careful to keep pace with REZA, a mousy Persi with a neatly trimmed moustache and a weathered knockoff Tommy Hilfiger T-shirt. He leads her to a small, rock hut a home.
Hurry! Come!
The camera follows Reza into a shanty.
If they catch you here it would be very bad for you.
Yeah. I know. Reza nods to his WIFE, in traditional garb. She nods back slides some sooty wooden shelves aside revealing --

head_text.subj: A PERSON-SIZED HOLE IN THE FLOOR THAT QUICKLY FADES TO

text: Scarlett smiles. She shines her mini flashlight into the hole, the ground about 10 feet down. She gets ready to climb in.
Wait. You’1l need this. Reza grabs a homemade rope ladder that’s tied to the base the stove and drops it into the hole.

Scarlett climbs into the dark cavern. As the camera crosses the threshold it moves into near to darkness. Background sound from the streets above become faint echoes. Reza drops down right behind her. A grinding sound as Reza’s wife slides the bookshelves ba into place, obliterating the light above. Once Scarlett gets her footing, she shines her flashlight down the cave corridor. It's long and dark. It's about 4 tall, forcing Scarlett and Reza into a crouched scamper.
We don’t have much time. They have already cleared the area. They race deeper and deeper into the cave.

head_text.subj: A MEGAPHONE SQUALL. THEY JUMP. SOMEONE SPEAKS FARSI INTO

text: They race back and take cover behind a rock. Scarlett gra rock off the floor in case she needs to use it as a weapo An ARMED GUARD passes, calling instructions out into the megaphone. If he just looks over his shoulder, he’1l see them. But he doesn’t.
We need to leave. We’re too late.
They're not blowing the caves until sundown, right? Scarlett checks her watch. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Should give us a few more minutes.
It’s too risky.
Which way is it? I'll go without you.
No.
I’m not leaving. Reza can see she’s not bluffing. And she’s not. He reluctantly continues.
Hurry! They race through one last corridor, then arrive at their destination --
There. Scarlett races to it - a wall full of ancient Coptic Christian inscriptions.
(whispers ) It’s even more beautiful than the pictures. She runs her fingers through the grooves as if she’s read braille. She quietly reads aloud in an ancient tongue.
We must hurry. Please! The camera seems to drift down, and she resets it a coupl times until--

How can anyone think straight with these head covers falling all She anxiously whips the veil off her head and throws it d on the floor beside her, RE-FRAMING THE CAVE IN AN AWKWAR ANGLE, CAPTURING SHE, REZA, AND THE WALL SIDEWAYS. She continues reading the inscriptions. SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s more. She looks around frantically, grabs a rock off the floor.
We have to go! She hacks away at the inscriptions with the rock, chiseli off chunks of stone with each hit.
What are you doing?!
They're going to blow it up anyway!
They’1l hear you! Stop! A whistle blows in the distance. Someone shouts in Farsi.
They're going to blow it.
I just need a minute.
We don’t have a minute! She analyzes the stone wall. Picks a specific spot marked an inscribed rose. Takes one more hit and THE WHOLE WALL COLLAPSES TO THE GROUND revealing --

head_text.subj: A GIANT STONE STATUE OF A BULL HOLDING A SNAKE IN ITS MOU

text: IT’S FACE IS FIERCE, OMINOUS, CREEPY. AND IT’S COVERED WI INSCRIPTIONS. One glance at it and Scarlett knows what it is.
Oh my God! Do you know what this is?! It takes her a moment to snap to. Reza grabs her and physically tries to escort her away.
We must go! Now! She pushes her way free.
I have been searching for this all my life! Go! I’1l catch up!

I’m sorry. I have a family. REZA RUNS OFF, LEAVING HER ALONE IN THE CAVE. Scarlett whips out a small piece of equipment the size of remote control from a small satchel hidden under her robe We hear faint voices on megaphones from down the tunnels The small scanner hums to life as it emits a solid line o green light. Scarlett begins to methodically blanket the statue with the laser, scanning it for future study.

Come on. The light creates eerie shadows of the statue on vaulted ceilings of the chamber. She's painfully slow making sure to get every detail of t ancient relic. The voices from the megaphones are getting louder and more foreboding. The voice in the megaphone seems to be doing a countdown, in the foreign language, it’s hard to tell which number i down to. Scarlett knows how close she’s cutting this, but she won’ lose this piece of history. She continues swiping the gre laser line from the scanner over every side of the bull. She's done! She grabs her headdress and runs like hell.

head_text.subj: A BLACK DUST CLOUD RUSHES PAST SCARLETT, LEAVING HER IN T
DARK IN THE CAVE. SHE COUGHS A COUPLE TIMES, BUT CONTINUE

text: Scarlett keeps racing forward, hoping the sounds of collapsing rock won’t catch her. She slams into something. SCARLETT (CONT’D)
Something moves. Sunlight cracks through the dust. The ro ladder drops. Scarlett climbs into the light.
And back into Reza’s house. She collapses on the ground, coughing furiously. She holds up the scanner.
I got it. I got it. She keeps coughing as Reza shakes his head.
You remind me so much of your father. But you must be more careful. His quest was a path to madness.

Note: The following Kickstarter video will be more “produ than the rest of the film - full of B-Roll, even music, glossy - a real presentational video. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - UNIVERSITY COLLEGE LONDON Scarlett, now in her “street clothes” has a punk-rock hip that’s hard to deny. She looks directly into the camera a talks.

Hello Kickstarter. My name is Scarlett Durang, and I may have just discovered the key to immortal life. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - DAY BENJI DONAGHAN, late 20s, a friendly, slightly heavy red Irishman. The devilish glint in his eyes reminds us of th rascally friend we all like to drink with when we need a laugh.
I’m Benji Donaghan. For those of you who’ve seen my previous documentaries like LONER or BROTHER IN ARMS, you know I am fascinated with obsessive personality types.

I’m a professor of archaeology at University College London. I have a PhD in Egyptology. A masters in chemistry and another PhD in linguistics. I am fluent in four spoken languages, and two dead ones. (she smiles) And I'm a blackbelt in Krav Maga.
I have yet to see her do anything. Literally anything at all that isn’t driven by her all-consuming quest to find the lost knowledge of the alchemists.

What is alchemy? She smiles. This is a big question. A montage of imagery: Alchemists, arcane symbols, representations of the Philosopher's Stone and the proces used to create it play over the following.

Alchemy was an early form of science in which the practitioners attempted to create a mythical substance known as the Philosopher's Stone, which could turn base metals to gold, cure disease and provide the key to eternal life.
Scarlett points to the house behind her.
600 years ago, the greatest of the alchemists, Nicolas Flamel, lived in this house in Paris. (MORE )
He was widely believed to have succeeded in developing the Philosopher’s Stone, which would have given him all the wealth he could dream of as well as eternal life.
Imagery of Flamel’s life done in the old style of woodcut

Though we don’t have definitive proof of this, we do know that he was a middle class book dealer who suddenly became one of the wealthiest men in Paris... Present day footage of buildings his money built. SCARLETT (CONT’D) ...-donating orphanages and hospitals all over the city, many of which still stand today.
Back to Scarlett.
In fact, he was so generous with this money, that 600 years later, this street in Paris is still named after him. The camera pans off her to the sign “Rue Nicolas Flamel” beside her.
Scarlett now stands near the Fontaine des Innocents - the last remnant of Paris’ original cemetery.

We also know that when grave robbers, hoping to get their hands on the Philosopher’s Stone, tried to dig his body up out of a cemetery that used to surround this spot here, they found his casket empty. As well as his wife’s.
Scarlett stands in front of an archaeological exhibit ina Parisian museum.

And we know that 400 years later, an archeologist working for King Louis XV met an old man in Turkey who knew things he believed only Nicolas Flamel could have known. He was convinced to his dying day that this man had been Flamel himself. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - DAY Again, Scarlett sits in her office talking to camera, tho she seems uncomfortable with the question asked of her.

I... came from a studious household, I guess. When I was 7, my mother died suddenly and... we took it really hard. My dad dropped everything to search for the key to everlasting life. And I went with him. Everywhere. Benji speaks to camera.
Her father was a Nobel Laureate! When he dropped out and went searching for Nicolas Flamel’s discovery, it was the scandal of academia. Everyone chalked it off to madness. Scarlett talks.
No, he wasn’t crazy. He just believed that some things in this universe aren’t wired together as simply as modern science might suggest.
Benji speaks.
After spending 20 years chasing clues, her father took his own life.
Scarlett stands in front of a glass case holding a GRAVES COVERED IN SYMBOLS at the Musee de Cluny.

This was Flamel’s gravestone, which he designed and carved himself. The camera zooms in on it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Many believe that the clues to the location of the Philosopher’s Stone is encoded in these arcane symbols, but its meaning has remained a mystery until this... She holds up a photograph of the statue she scanned in Ir SCARLETT (CONT’D) The fabled “Rose Key,” a kind of Rosetta Stone deciphering alchemical symbols into Aramaic. INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE
We are seeking money to both finance the expedition to find this mythical stone, and for me to shoot a documentary chronicling Scarlett’s journey.
Let us conquer death together.

INT. SCARLETT’S OFFICE - EVENING Note: from this point forward, everything will be shown i “raw footage” style.  12. The camera powers on, settling on Scarlett at the compute This lacks all the polish displayed in the promo video. T is the beginning of the documentary footage. Scarlett sits at her computer.
Hit refresh. She does. The camera turns to reveal: of $30,000 they’re trying to raise to make their documentary, they are $29,9 of the way there.
Almost there!
Hit it again.
Give it a moment. She can’t wait. She hits it.
Some moment. $29,990.
So close.
Hit it again. Hit it again.
You. He hits it. “FUNDED!” Scarlett pops a bottle of champagne, pours them each a gl SCARLETT (CONT’D) Get on camera! He does. They clink glasses.
How do you feel?
Like it’s time to get to work. She motions to her statue of the Rose Key.  13.
Now all we need is someone who can read Aramaic. (She smiles wryly) Good thing I know a guy.

Scarlett sees a small crowd gathered on a street watching GEORGE, late 20s, handsomely enthusiastic in a bookish wa One look and you know he’s the kind of warm-hearted guy y could always depend on in a pinch.

This is what I love about Paris. You can literally step up to any corner and there are layers and layers of history going back thousands of years. Someone, name an era. A couple hands go up. George points at one.
French Revolution.

Oh, there’s a good one for that. Look at this street right here. In 1795 royalist sympathizers stormed the streets threatening the deputies of the National Convention. Benji walks the camera closer as George talks.

Napoleon Bonaparte, recently made Commander of the Army of the Interior, was asked to stop them. So what does he do? He fires cannons into the crowd! Cannons loaded with pellets so they would literally decimate hundreds of people. So what do you think the government did when they found out? You think they reprimanded him? Put him in jail? Anything? No! They promoted him! You do not want to piss off the French. He looks around at the crowd.  14.
Okay, who wants to pick another era?
The era of Nicolas Flamel? George knows that voice. He looks like he’s just been hit a 2x4 as he spots Scarlett there listening to him.
(to the class) Give me a moment, please. George walks to Scarlett.
Whatever it is, I want no part of it.
You haven’t even heard...
I'll save you the time. No. George looks to the camera guy.
Who's this guy? (looks to Benji) Who are you?
He’s making a film about my search for...
I’m Benji.
(to Benji) Word to the wise... walk, don’t run from this one!
You mean run don’t walk?
Yeah. Shut up. (to Benji) Did she tell you last time I saw her, I literally wound up in a Turkish prison?!  15.
It was more like a jail than a prison. George looks at the camera guy and points at her. You get a load of this?!
It was jail. In Turkey. Think she was there waiting for me when I got out?
(sheepish) I couldn’t let the lead go dead.
God forbid. Well go on, chase your lead. See how far that gets you. I have a class to teach. He turns to walk away.
I found the Rose Key. This stops him in his tracks.
You did?
Yeah.
It was in Iran wasn’t it. (catches himself) Forget I asked, I don’t care. (stops) It was though, wasn’t it.
Yes.
I knew it! Ha! I knew it!
I need your help translating the Aramaic.
Wait. Did you go to Iran?!  16.
It doesn’t matter who went.
You did, didn’t you. By yourself?
It doesn’t matter who...
You are such a lunatic. (to the camera) She is a total lunatic. Be careful. (to Scarlett) I‘1ll help translate. But that’s it!
Okay. He smiles, excited despite himself.

(before going) I knew it would be in Iran. INT. GEORGE’S ARCHAEOLOGICAL WORKSHOP - EVENING George and Scarlett look over a small model replica of th statue she found in Iran and a large photo printing of Flamel’s tombstone. Scarlett waits anxiously as George analyzes the symbols writes as he goes. The room is full of artifacts, mud, microscopes. All bone and clay and dirt. All function, no form. Completely lack a woman’s touch.
Almost done?
Shh. She paces. She’s been waiting for this moment all her lif George puts his pen down.
Okay.
What does it say?!
("oh my God!) It says the Philosopher’s Stone is in the Champs Elysee’s Starbucks bathroom.
Seriously.
Okay, let me read. I think it’s in couplets, so let me try to get the rhythm right.
Just tell me what...
Let me do this right... (reads ) “Winged vulture leads your way, with brightest light, in darkest day. Scarlett sits, not sure what this means.
Underneath the heaven's reign, what is lost shall be regained, when halfway twixt the darkest gate and this tablet laid atop this pair'ed fate.
Parrot?!
Pair’ed.
Pair’ed? You mean paired?
Yes. But paired doesn’t rhyme.
And it has to rhyme?
It rhymed in Aramaic. I’m trying to do justice to the translation. 17.  18.
This tablet? You’re sure it said this tablet?!
Of course I’m sure.
This tablet. The headstone is a marker.
Where it was, in a cemetery that no longer exists.
Yeah. “Underneath the heaven's reign, what is lost shall be regained...”
“What is lost shall be regained.”
That’s got to be the Philosopher's Stone.
Maybe.
“Underneath heaven’s reign...” could be under the night sky...
Or under this tombstone! It’s got a night sky right on it.
Yeah.
“darkest gate...”
Hell. “Darkest gate.” The gates of hell.
Okay. But that gives us nothing. Halfway between his grave and the gates of hell?  19.
Wait, wait, wait! Scarlett rushes to a SMALL NOTEBOOK FULL OF ALCHEMICAL SYMBOLS AND TEXT. It looks like something written by a madman.
What’s that?

My dad’s notebook. He left it to me. There was something... She rifles through it, finds a page. She slams the book d on the table. George looks at it as the camera looks on. It’s a replica an arcane drawing of the heavenly bodies above the earth, ground, and hell within. But the thing that makes this interesting... the distances are noted.
It has the distances they believed between heaven and earth and hell!
According to the alchemists, the number of the Devil was 741. Makes sense they would believe hell to be 741 feet beneath the surface of the earth.
So halfway twixt this tablet and...
370.5 feet directly beneath his tombstone is where we’ll find the Philosopher’s Stone.
Feet were a bit shorter back then. More like 10.8 inches per foot. Won’t be hard to...
How are we going to get 370 feet into the earth?
Scarlett, you're in Paris! She gets his meaning.  20.
The catacombs!
What are “the catacombs?”
It’s a network of tunnels under the streets of Paris, that spans over 200 miles...? No, nothing? He sees Benji really doesn’t know anything about it, so h goes on.
In the 1700s, the Cemetaire des Innocents...
Where the Flamel and his wife were supposedly buried.

Was so full of hundreds of years of dead bodies, that the entire city stank, and people were getting sick. It was disgusting. So... they took all the lime quarries under the city and used them to house the remains of some 6 million bodies. He lets that sink in.
Six million?!
It’s by far the world’s largest crypt.
So we might be able to just walk right on down there?
And get your Philosopher's Stone. Which, for the record, I don’t really actually believe in.
You will.  21.
Scarlett, George and Benji stand on a street corner near where the Flamels were allegedly buried. Scarlett refers her father’s notebook.
According to Sir Isaac Newton, who was a legendary alchemist, Flamel’s grave was twenty seven paces due north from the fountain.

Let’s walk it out. She paces her steps, counting as she goes. She waves to traffic as she walks right through the busy Paris intersection. George shakes his head, looks to Benji. She stops. Calls back to them.
Right...

The camera spins as A CAR SCREECHES TO A STOP RIGHT BESID SCARLETT AND THE CAMERA, scaring the shit out of them bot They get out of the street. Scarlett takes a breath, tryi to play off the adrenalin surging through her veins.
370.5 feet below that point.
Scarlett marks a large map of Paris with a red x.
This is where Flamel’s grave was. George lifts a map of the catacombs printed on transparen and pins it over the map of Paris. FLAMEL’S GRAVE FALLS IN AN AREA WITHOUT TUNNELS UNDER IT.
Shit.
Shit.  22.
What is it?
The catacombs don’t go under Flamel’s grave. Scarlett takes a step back. Thinking.
So what do we do?
We? There’s no we here. I’m helping with translation. That’s it. Scarlett chooses to ignore him.
Maybe we could burrow in through this tunnel.
Burrow in? You know how thick these walls are? They’re made of solid granite, and they’ve all been reinforced since.... Something occurs to George.
«+. parts of the city collapsed into it! George looks like he’s just been struck by lightning. He feverishly grabs a small handful of pins, races to the map.
In 1774, about 100 feet of Avenue Denfert-Rochereau... He places a pin in the map.
Was literally swallowed up into the ground, falling 100 feet into the earth. He places another pin.  23.

Another collapse happened a few years later at Barriére d'Enfer. Followed by a collapse here at... Avenue des Fontaines! He places a pin right next to the “x” marking Flamel’s gr Scarlett gets where he’s going with this.
Why would the street collapse if it’s nothing but solid ground underneath it?!
Exactly!
There must be a hidden chamber!
It would appear so.
We have to get down there.
Again, there’s no “we” here.
George and Scarlett approach the entrance to the official tourist area of the catacombs where other tourists wait i line. Scarlett buys tickets.
Three tickets please.
Oh, no, I’m not going in. Just two tickets. Scarlett shoots George a strange look.
Three. Scarlett buys three tickets despite George’s reservations  24.
I’m serious. I’m not going in there.
Don’t tell me you’re scared of a little cave?
I... have a thing.
What kind of thing?
I don’t go underground.
You're an archaeologist!
I know. But I never go underground.
That's kind of sad. It’s like being a deaf composer or something.
Regardless, you’re not getting me down there.
Benji films Scarlett following the official tour of THE CATACOMBS. Bones and plaques neatly arranged in a morbid antiseptic display. A French tour guide tours the group of Americans and Brit

By the 1700s, residents from all over Paris were complaining about the horrible smell of the bodies in the overcrowded cemetery. Something had to be done. Louis the 15th, officially ordered the cemeteries within city limits closed... Another shot:  25. TOUR GUIDE (CONT’D) +. and the remains be brought down here in the old quarries that had been used to build the city.
This place is creeping me out. I don’t like being in a tomb. Scarlett sees a plaque. “Cemetaire des Innocents.” She turns and talks to the camera.
These remains are from the same cemetery as the Flamels’ graves. Scarlett references her map.

So, we're looking to go about half a mile right through this wall. As the tour guide continues, Scarlett cases the structure like an inmate looking for weak links in a prison. Scarlett finds a small gap between the walls. She looks around. The tour is making a little distance.
I can squeeze through this. Wait for me. She climbs through the gap in the walls and disappears in the darkness.
Jesus. You kidding me?
(loud whisper) Shine the light in here. Benji shines a light into the crevasse. Nothing.
Scarlett? He turns the camera back to the tour, still barely out of sight, but coming back.
Scarlett?!  26. Nothing.
shit. He leans the camera in closer to get a better look, completely getting unnerved by this whole thing.

head_text.subj: SCARLETT LUNGES OUT A THE CAMERA
BENJI JUMPS BACK AWAY FROM THE HOLE, DROPPING THE CAMERA.

text: Scarlett finds herself pretty funny.
You're going to make me break the damned camera!
Sorry.

You are not allowed back there! Please get back into the group! INT. CATACOMBS TOUR ENTRANCE AREA — DAY On the way out, the TICKET TAKER looks punk rock cool. He smiles to Scarlett. She approaches him.
(quietly) Do you know any way to get into the private areas of the catacombs? The Ticket Taker looks around sheepishly.
No.
Thanks anyway. She notes his Die Antwoord t-shirt.
I saw them in Berlin last April. One of the best nights of my life.  27.
George waits outside.
You missed a nice tour.
Good.
I didn’t see anything that could have... The Ticket Taker hustles to Scarlett. He hands her a club flyer for Club Silencio.
Ask for Papillon.
Thanks. She nods to him. He nods back and leaves. She holds it up for George to see.
Let’s go find Papillon.
Scarlett, George and Benji get out of a cab.
You sure this is the place?

That's what it says. Nothing from the street would indicate this was a club. J an average-sized MAN sipping a vodka in front of a nondescript door. Scarlett leads George to the door. The Man stops them. Po to a list.
We’re not on the list. He shrugs his shoulders. Not happening.  28. SCARLETT (CONT’D) We're looking for Papillon.
Ah, Papillon?! Why didn't you say so? He opens the door and shows them inside.
Scarlett, George and Benji enter a bizarre Parisian night that resembles a beautifully designed bunker. The Man points to the back of the room.
Papillon la.

Merci. She leads George and Benji through dancers and lounge-liz to some tables in the back. She finds PAPILLON, sipping a red drink, talking excitedl with friends. Had he been born half a century ago, Papillon surely woul have been a leader of the French Resistance, but in these times must amuse himself with less constructive forms of rebellion. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Papillon?
Qui étes-vous?
I need to get into the catacombs. I’m told you could take me. He laughs.
Do I look like a tour guide to you?
Do I look like a tourist? He smiles. Takes a sip of his drink.  29.
Why would I want to bring you down there? She takes a map of the catacombs out of her pocket and sl it onto the table in front of him.
Because we've found a secret passage that nobody knows about. Papillon looks at the markings. Shakes his head.
We would have found it if it was there.
No you wouldn’t have. It was designed to not be seen.
Why would that be?
Because, I believe, it’s full of treasure. Papillon laughs. Looks to George.
Is she serious? George nods. PAPILLON (CONT’D) Me and my friends can take half this treasure?
You can have it all. That’s not what we're looking for.
Half is probably fine.
You are a strange girl, aren’t you.
You don’t know the half of it.  30. INT. PAPILLON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Papillon throws a couple pairs of rubber waders and helme to George and Scarlett.
Try these.
Oh, I’m not going in. I’m just here for support.
He’s coming. George, I need your help.
This guy seems to know what he’s doing.
But who knows what we’1ll come across down there. I can’t decipher it all without you. Come on, we were a good team, remember?
Text it to me and I'll...
No cell phones down there. Ground is too dense.
So there’s no way to call for help if something goes wrong?
No.
Then I’m definitely not going. A knock at the door.

(shouts ) Entrez! (to Scarlett) My team. In walks ZED, a quiet, squirrely Frenchman of 25, with la calves and strong hands. A perfectly designed climbing machine.  31. He’s trailed by SOUXIE, a motherly Goth girl. She’s the d mother of the cataphiles. PAPILLON (CONT’D) This is Zed, the last letter in climbing. And Souxie. The banshee. She sees all the waders and helmets and everything all ov the place.
Ah, what a mess Papillon!
She also manages our supplies. Souxie sorts through the supplies.
The group stands around a map of the catacombs.
We'll enter through the park. That will make it easier to find La Taupe.
La Taupe?
“The Mole.”
He lives down there.
He lives down there?!
Oui.
Weird. Papillon points to a spot on the map.
He is usually around...
But that’s the wrong direction.  32.
Sometimes going the wrong direction is the quickest way.
Do we really need this guy? We have Maps and...
Oui. We need this guy. INT. PAPILLON’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Souxie counts out all the flashlights, clothes, etc. She tests each flashlight herself. She notices the camera and talks.
It is dangerous underground. If you run out of batteries, and no flashlight, you will die. If you run out of water... If you get hurt.
There are also dangers of cave ins, police, rats, bats, claustrophobia, drowning, bugs.
Many things can go wrong down there. We need to plan for them all. There is no room for mistakes. Papillon checks food and water.
And we always bring enough food and water for a week.
A week?! Papillon shrugs his shoulders.

Scarlett and George follow Souxie, Papillon, and Zed into dark wooded area in a park in Paris.  33. Papillon stops them about 50 feet shy of a dirt mound wit hole in it, surrounded by concrete and graffiti. The hole looks more like something a raccoon would live in. He and Zed scan the area for police.
The police hate me here. All clear.
They approach the hole. A tight fit dropping into darknes Not something you’d ever want to climb into.
You're going in that?! Seriously?
Let’s turn on the cameras. Benji comes around beside Scarlett. He turns on the GoPro attached to her headlamp. He makes a dipshit face into th camera.
B camera, good check. He approaches Zed, who also has one on his headlamp. Benj flips it on. Makes a dipshit face into camera.
C camera good check. Benji nods to Papillon. Ready. Scarlett hands George a ruck sack.
Here. He looks at it.
What’s this?
Your bag.
You have some serious listening skill issues.  34.
Zed... Allez! Zed drops through the hole.
Zed climbs swiftly through a jagged shaft of rock to the floor of the catacombs.
Clear!
George and Scarlett continue their discussion.
I need you on this.
Scarlett, I’m sorry.
Souxie... Allez! Souxie disappears through the hole. PAPILLON (CONT’D) (to George) I don’t care what you do, but make up your mind now.
I’m not coming.
He’s coming.

head_text.subj: OUT OF NOWHERE, PAPILLON IS TAKEN DOWN RIGHT THROUGH THE
CAMERA FROM AN OPEN FIELD TACKLE BY A PARISIAN POLICEMAN.

text: A whistle blows. The camera spins to find a second police running toward them.
Allez! Allez! Allez!
Sorry George.  35. She jumps through the hole and disappears. George stands there, looking at his bag. At the hole. At oncoming policeman.
Shit. Shit. Shit.
Allez! Allez! Benji jumps through the hole with the camera, followed closely by George.
Benji makes his way down though the jagged rocks as Zed points out the safe places to steps. George appears, with ruck sack.

You fuckers. Shit! Scarlett looks around the catacombs. This is much rougher than the official tourist area, but in its way, much more beautiful. Paintings and graffiti on the walls give it an urban, cool vibe.
This is beautiful. George looks a bit shell shocked to be down here. Scarlet greets him.
I knew you’d come with us.
Yeah, thanks. Papillon appears above, dropping like a bat into hell. He hits every wall on the way down.
Allez! Allez! Allez! Papillon digs furiously in his pockets as they race throu the tunnels, fleeing from the police.
Arret! Arret!  36. Papillon lights up a smoke bomb, drops it. The effect of gathering smoke is eerie, unsettling.
Careful! Papillon leaps over a two foot hole in the floor. Followe Scarlett, and the rest. He motions into an alcove where they wait for the smoke t clear.
The catacombs make the police nervous. They don’t like to go very deep in here.
I don’t blame them. As the smoke clears, they see:
They are in a kind of artists’ gallery. The walls are all painted, beautiful. The police are nowhere to be found.

Ha ha. Police will never catch Papillon! An ARTIST creeps out of the shadows and curses Papillon o for bringing the authorities there. He hates the smoke bo and despises the tourists that Papillon brought with him.
Cessez de réduire la police ici!
Détendez. Je les ai évités avant que nous soyons arrivés ici.
Et cette fumée ruine ma peinture.
Bonne chose que votre peinture est terrible. Scarlett approaches the Artist’s work. It really is beautiful.  37.
C'est trés beau. The Artist appreciates this very much.
Merci.
Avez-vous vu la Taupe?
Non. Il n'a pas 6té par ici.
La Taupe has not been here. We must look for him.
There are over 200 miles of tunnels. You suggesting we wander them aimlessly until we find this weirdo?
Je ne sais pas. Papillon leads them on.
Papillon leads them through a corridor as Scarlett looks her map.
(calling out) La Taupe? C’est moi, Papillon.
Wait! We’re going in the wrong direction. We need to be going that way.
We haven’t found La Taupe.
Is it possible that he’s not down here?
The artist said he just saw La Taupe a couple hours ago.  38.
No he didn’t. I speak French. That’s not what he said.
La Taupe knows every cave. Scarlett holds up her map.
So do I.

You think because you see something in a book you know it?! Papillon smacks the map as he talks. Going the PAPILLON (CONT’D) This is not the catacombs! This will not tell you anything! Which ones are filled with water? Which ones are too full of bones to pass? Which ones have collapsed?! If you want to follow this map go ahead. I’m going to find La Taupe because these caves are dangerous and you need to know where you're going!
I’m going. Who’s with me.
Scarlett. He’s right.
Why are we wasting our time with...
You know I don’t want to spend an extra minute down here than I have to. But if this guy says he needs La Taupe, I’m inclined to trust him.
He doesn’t even know that the guy is down here. Or where he is. slow way is very much against Scarlett’s nature.
If the stone is down here, it’s been here for six hundred years. (MORE )
It’ll keep for a couple extra hours. She reluctantly relents.
Okay. George turns to Papillon.
Now, don’t make me look like an asshole. As they cross through another room, strange electronic mu plays.
Come.

Papillon leads them through a slightly larger space. On o side, half a dozen cataphiles sit in what look like stone bleachers cut into the wall. On the other side, a movie -- the old silent version of “Phantom of the Opera” with Lon Chaney. The image has bee “remixed” to Aphex Twin, creating an interesting blend of and new. The movie shows the Phantom descending under the Parisian Opera house into the catacombs.
Our cinema. George looks at the relaxed Parisians watching a movie do here.
You guys are freaks.
As they cross through a corridor, Papillon points out a s replica of the Bocca della Verita in Rome. (A giant disk carved face with an open mouth.) He nudges George, points at it.  40.
According to legend, this statue will bite off your hand if you tell a lie. George is loosening up a bit.
Let's give it a shot. He reaches his hand toward it, thinks for a moment.
You might not believe this, but my nipples are perfectly shaped like little Elvis heads. Early Elvis. George slides his hand into the carved mouth.

head_text.subj: SENDING BATS SHOOTING OUT FROM THE STATUE

text: Aaah! Shit! I hate this place. Papillon has a good laugh at George.

Yeah, thanks guy. As they cross to the far end of the corridor, they hear something -- A kind of industrial dance music. The beats build as they closer. Papillon looks to the others, does a little rave-y dance, smiles, and runs toward the music. George and Scarlett look to each other. This fucking guy. The music gets louder as they get closer. As they turn a bend, they see:

AN underground rave, lit in flashing reds and pulsing tec music. People shuffle and dance like the possessed. At a glance, it looks like people might be having sex in dark corners. Others are scantily clad, in underwear or l People wearing masks and horns and animal headdresses. Th kind of underground party we all know probably happens somewhere, but would never get invited to ourselves.  41. Papillon pushes his way through the crowd, trying to ask people - through the noise - if they’ve seen La Taupe. A SKINHEAD grabs Scarlett, pulls her into the crowd, star grinding on her. He’s wearing nothing but combat boots an his underwear, revealing a swastika on his chest. Scarlett pushes away, but he’s aggressive. George jumps forward, hitting the Skinhead across the fac slamming him back through the crowd and onto his back. Other Ravers jump to the Skinhead’s aid, striking George the mouth. Scarlett tries to intervene on George’s behalf but no words can be heard over the pulsing music. People, very tough, very scary people corner George. One takes a swing, but George blocks it. George gets ready fo real fight. He’s amped up. Scarlett inserts herself between George and the crowd. Papillon pushes his way through, and holds the ravers off George. Scarlett and George push their way through the crowd and out of the room.
As they clear the room, the flashlights overpower the strobes. They can hear again. George touches the back of his hand to his mouth and sees blood.
(to Scarlett) You’re welcome.
I didn’t thank you.
That guy was all over you.
I could've handled it myself.
Yeah, really?  42.
Those people are crazy people. Dangerous people. Papillon makes a crazy sign with his hands. PAPILLON (CONT’D) You overreact.
I literally punched a Nazi. How am I suddenly the asshole?
I’m not some damsel in distress. I don’t need your help. George looks around. At himself. In the catacombs.
Yeah? Since when?
(playful) Don’t kid yourself. You wouldn’t want to go toe-to-toe with me. I’m pretty tough.
You?! That’s ridiculous. She draws a line in the sand on the floor. Stands on Geor side of it.
Try to move me across this line. I’1l show you. Papillon laughs and claps.
I’m not going to push a girl.
Because you’re scared of her?

I’m not... this is so stupid. What, you have some self-defense-class-— karate-move you learned in case somebody tries to grab you? That’s all well and good unless somebody pushes you...  43. He rushes at her.
Scarlett steps toward him, nails him in the solar plexus, knocking the wind out of George.
oh!
I might know a little more than a self-defense-class-karate-move. Papillon laughs, raises her hand up in victory.
The champion!
I think he just called you a mushroom.
They enter an alcove with bright fluorescent paint on the walls, a lot of it of mushrooms or other hallucinogenic-— inspired motifs. Papillon calls down a tunnel.
La Taupe? They are all looking a bit tired. They’ve covered a lot o ground already. A voice calls out from the darkness.
Chantez-le? Papillon stops, does a weird little jig.
(sings) La Taupe, La Taupe, La Taupe. C’est moi, c’est moi, c’est moi. Papi, Papi, Papi, ion, ion ion. From the darkness, a voice sings.

Papi, papi, papi, ion, ion, ion. C'est moi, c’est moi aussi, La Taupe est le garcon! La Taupe rushes out of the shadows and gives Papillon a b hug, his face obscured in shadows under his hooded sweatshirt.
Mon ami étrange!
Mon ami puant! La Taupe looks at Scarlett and George suspiciously. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Qui sont-elles ?
Ils sont ok. Vous ne vous inquiétez pas.
Pourquoi ont-ils des appareils- photo?
Ils font un documentaire environ...

Non! La Taupe covers his face with his hand. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) (to the camera) You cannot film me! I do not permit to you filming me. Benji drops the camera low. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Go. Get out of these place! He takes a beer bottle and throws it at them, almost hitt George.
Whoa! Papillon holds up a hand. Give me a sec. He walks off wit Taupe.  45.
This doesn’t bode well. George and the gang watch Papillon and La Taupe exchange terse words. After a discussion, Papillon returns.
He will join us.
Great.
If we still want him. Guy threw a bottle at my head.
He just threw it. It wasn’t at your head.
It skimmed my head. I felt it on my hair.
But first he sleeps.
Sleeps?! Did you say, “first he sleeps?!"
He has eaten the... how you say... Papillon looks around, points to a graffiti image of a mushroom. PAPILLON (CONT’D) These.
Mushrooms?
Oui. Mushrooms.
He’s on mushrooms?!
Yes.
How long ago did he eat them?  46.
Two hours.
So he’s going to be high for like another six?! Scarlett looks at him. George shrugs his shoulders. I kno what's up.
We stay here for the night.
For the night?!
Yes. We sleep.
No. Fuck this. I’m out. I gotta get out of this place. I’m packing my shit up and leaving.
How will you find your way back out?
It’s that way. The camera pans off to show the long, dark corridor, Geor points at.
Go ahead. Try. We’ll send a search party for you in a couple days.
You know, I’m getting real sick of your tone.
I’m sure the skinhead party would love to see you again without me to save you.
You didn’t save me.
Why don’t you just try to relax.  47.

Because I’m trapped under the ground! In a rat filled tunnel that was dug in the 1500s. Our tour guide is high as a kite and so far we've been walking in the wrong direction. What could possibly stop me from relaxing?! Papillon lights up a joint. Offers some to George.
Perfect solution. Let’s everyone get high. I’m sure nothing bad could happen then. Papillon turns to walk away.
Wait. Give me that. George has a hit off the joint.
It’s good, yes?
We have better in America. Papillon smiles. George does too. Maybe this won’t be so

Glow sticks light the space to save flashlights. La Taupe, now wearing a kind of industrial mole mask that he’1l continue to wear, spins little flaming balls on str to music. It’s kind of beautiful. Souxie takes something out of a small kit. She crosses ou the room into the darkness of a tunnel by herself. Papillon drinks beer and talks with Scarlett and La Taupe Zed practices throwing rocks into a bucket.
You don’t seem like a treasure hunter.
I’m not really.  48.
Then why search for this stone?
It doesn’t make any sense! A rock that can turn other rocks to gold and - AND - can also make you live forever. Doesn’t make sense.

Science was different back then. Alchemists were looking for a connection between what was inside them and what they were observing in the outside world. They were trying to perfect themselves, make themselves pure as gold while working in metals. They respected inner truth more than outside facts. She turns back to Papillon. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I guess I’m not searching for treasure so much as I’m searching for proof of the miraculous. Because if even one alchemist succeeded, if one perfected himself and his own mind and talents and knowledge to the point that he could bend the laws of physics... then we all could. Every one of us. Papillon shrugs. Maybe.
Gold is good too. Scarlett grabs a couple beers and crosses the room toward George. The camera turns to George, anxiously sitting alone. Scarlett approaches George with a beer.
You okay? George shrugs a bit.
Not my favorite place.  49.
So I gathered. She offers George a beer. He takes it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) When’s the last time we had a beer together?
It’s been awhile, hasn’t it.
You never returned my calls. After Turkey.
I know.
I’m sorry I left you there.
I know.
I’m glad you're here.
(reluctant) Yeah. Me too. If you’re right, this could be the greatest archaeological find... ever. As big as finding the Holy Grail.
I know. George looks around the space.
I used to love exploring caves with my brother as a kid. He was so daring and cool and older. He remembers it all so vividly.

A rock I was standing on dislodged and rolled onto his leg, pinning him. We tried and tried but couldn’t get him out. I went to get help, but I got lost trying to find my way back.  50. This pains George terribly.
By the time we found him, the tide had come in, and he was gone.
That’s awful. I’m sorry.
Yeah. It was. He shrugs.
It wasn’t because you left me there.
What’s that?
Why I didn’t call you back. It wasn’t because you left me.
It wasn’t? He looks at her seriously.
I was afraid I was falling in love with someone so obsessed with the dead, there’s no room left over to love the living. She takes this in for a moment. Not one to take criticism easily.
And I never thought I’d fall for the kind of guy who runs the second things get complicated. She turns and goes back to the fire with the others.
Shit. Camera powers off.  51.
Darkness. Snores. Sleeping people rustling around. Someon moves in the space.

Suddenly, the opening chords of the White Stripes, “I Thi Smell a Rat” rip through the darkness. Everyone frantically searches for a light. George is first to get his hands on a flashlight which he flips on and looks for the source of the music. It’s La Taupe in his industrial mole mask, blaring a ster at them, “Say Anything” style. He dances to the music and laughs at their startled reactions. He turns off the music.
We go. La Taupe turns and leaves down a corridor, expecting them catch up.
(under his breath) Asshole. The bleary-eyed explorers hustle to pack up and follow.
(to Papillon) This “Mole” guy always so annoying? Papillon shakes his head.
He gets worse.
La Taupe winds them through corridor after corridor. He k his way around here like his own neighborhood. George tries to talk with him.  52.
Papillon told me you pretty much live down here?
Down here there is no rules. No law. Here I do whatever I want when I want it.
You do a lot of drugs, don’t you.
Yes. George looks around.
I can’t imagine a place I'd less want to eat mushrooms. (thinks) Maybe jail. It’s a toss up.
La Taupe stops in front of a corridor filled with human bones.
Stay on top. Parce que rats.
Careful there are...
Yeah, we get it. La Taupe scrambles over the bones effortlessly. George goes next, followed by Scarlett, each crawling beh the next.

(to George) Come closer. Get close. George crawls over the bones, getting closer behind La Ta not sure why Taupe is asking him to do so. La Taupe rips a fart right into George’s face, and laughs George looks back to Scarlett.  53.

Not sure why the French have such a reputation for being rude. I've always found them so pleasant. The camera moves with Scarlett as she climbs across the bones. She is anxious as the bones creak underneath her. swarm of rats make noise underneath. The tunnel gets tighter and tighter as they go, to the po that Scarlett is barely thin enough to fit through. Benji gets caught.
I’m stuck.
Fat tourist!
(to La Taupe) Arret!
I can’t move. Scarlett struggles to turn back to Benji.
Can you take off your pack?
I already did. Benji struggles more and more against the space.
You're making it worse! Stop struggling. Take a breathe.
Ah! The rats are nipping at me. Go! Just go! I need to get out of here!
Benji stop! Stop! You need to back up a bit. You’re lodged and...
Fuck! I hate this.
Move back. Just inch back.  54.
No! No! Just...
Benji! The only way forward is backward! INCH BACK! INCH BACK!
Okay, okay. He inches back.
There are people behind me too! I just need to get out of here! I don’t like this.
Move your right shoulder down and inch back. Benji moves. SCARLETT (CONT’D) No, no, no, I’m sorry. Your left shoulder.
I'm freaking out. I need to get out.
Keep breathing. Just take a deep breath with me.
No, I need...

Take a deep breath! Scarlett takes a deep breath and exhales. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Your body expands when your blood pressure rises. You need to calm yourself. Come on. She does it again. He joins her this time.
It’s not helping.  55.
You're going to be okay. Move your right shoulder down an inch.
Like this?
That's right. Now see if you can adjust the bones underneath you. Flatten them out, line them up.
Just do it.
Okay. His shaking hands arrange the bones.
Ow! A rat just bit me! Ah! Fuck!
It’s okay. It’s okay, Benji. You’re going to be fine. Just follow me. Benji pulls against the cave. It rumbles slightly.
It’s gonna collapse.
Just push! Push through it! He does. And finally breaks free.
They all file out of the bone tunnel.

This is why we don’t bring fat Irish tourist to the catacombs. La Taupe jabs his finger into Benji’s gut.  56. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) This guy, this fat guy he do not belong here. Fat guy, you should have taken fat man hall. La Taupe points to another hallway that leads to this sam end point. They didn’t have to do this to Benji.
We didn’t even have to go through there?! Why are you making this harder than it has to be?!
It’s more interesting this way. Scarlett snaps. She pushes him up against the wall.
I don’t care who you think you are, but the next time you take a chance with my people, I’1l hurt you. Seriously. La Taupe’s mouth, showing under his mole mask, smiles.
English girl has fire. He nods that he understands, amused by Scarlett’s spunk. The ceiling dusts them all a bit.
We shouldn’t stay very long.
Was that bad? They look to see a stone pillar that should be holding up ceiling has fallen.
That is bad.
We're still not deep enough. We’re only two hundred feet below ground. We need to go down another hundred. The ceiling dusts them again.  57.
I think we should move out of this area. It seems suspect to me.
(to La Taupe) We need to go deeper. He reluctantly nods.
Come.

La Taupe leads them into the next corridor. He shines his light around until he finds some planks of wood on the ground. He pries them up, revealing a hole in the floor t goes very deep. George looks at it.
This is a bad idea, Scarlett.
Papillon, could you take George and anyone else back who wants to go? I’m going deeper.
And let you keep all the treasure? No, I’m going with you.
(to Scarlett) At what point will you stop?
When I find it.
And if there is no stone?
There is. And it’s down there. She nods to La Taupe.
Allez.  58.
One after another, they descend deeper and deeper into th catacombs. They’re all feeling the tension of going this underground. George looks up to the vast distance above him.
(to La Taupe) How do you know we’ll all be able to get back up there?
If we can’t, we die. So we will.
Not really the answer I was hoping for.
They all wade through the muck 300 feet underground. Spir are sagging.
How long have we been walking? George looks at his watch.
About 6 hours.
Can we stop to eat soon?
Hungry fat Irish.
Jesus, give it a rest! At least I live in the real world! This kind of animosity is settling over all of them.
(sings) Just sit right back and you'll hear a tale, A tale of a fateful trip, That started from this tropic port Aboard this tiny ship. Scarlett smiles. Joins in.  59.
The mate was a mighty sailing man, The skipper brave and sure. Five passengers set sail that day For a three hour tour... Benji jumps in too.
a three hour tour. Papillon won’t be outdone. He jumps in on the next stanza French, trying to out-sing them with the French version o the song.

The weather started getting Devenir commencée par temps rough, rugueuse, Le bateau minuscule The tiny ship was tossed, a été jeté en l'air, Sinon If not for the courage of the pour le courage de 1'équipa fearless crew courageux que le Vairon The Minnow would be lost, the serait détruit, le Vairon Minnow would be lost. soyez détruit. The other French speakers jump in too, everyone now singi at the top of their lungs for language domination.

head_text.subj: GEORGE, SOPHIE AND BEN PAPILLON, TAUPE, SOUXIE, ZED

text: (CONT'D) La terre réglée de bateau sur The ship set ground on the le rivage de cette ile shore of this uncharted inexplorée de désert avec desert isle Gilligan With Gilligan Le capitaine aussi, The Skipper too, Le millionnaire et son The millionaire and his wife, épouse, The movie star La star de cinéma, le The professor and Mary Ann, professeur et Mary Ann, ici Here on Gilligans Isle. sur l'ile de Gilligans. They all get so loud, they miss La Taupe shouting to them
Arret! Arret! They all stop. They have reached the end of the tunnel. Nothing but a wall in front of them. Scarlett references her map.
Should be another ten feet that way.  60.
There is no more. Scarlett picks up a stone and taps on the wall. Solid. She looks around, thinking.
There must be another way to get there. La Taupe consults his own personal map of the system of caves. He shakes his head.
There is no more. C’est fini. They all look for any sign of anything. But there is noth there.
Does this mean, no treasure?
I don’t know.

(bummed ) Dommage. I was excited to be rich. Scarlett scans the surface for a sign, an inscription, anything. She thinks and thinks. She looks at her map. Mutters to herself, thinking through everything that’s led them here getting more and more frustrated.
There’s nothing.
Sorry Scarlett.
I really thought we had it right.
I know. He sees how sad she is.
For what it’s worth, I thought we had it right too.  61.
Are we ready to go the other direction?
Scarlett.
Yeah... Scarlett looks down at the compass on her wrist. A flash insight! SCARLETT (CONT’D) Wait! Wait! Direction! Magnetic north!
What?
Magnetic north! True north remains fixed, but magnetic north shifts about 2.5 degrees per hundred years.
Which by now would have produced Asee
Variation of about 15 degrees. Not here. There! A second small tunnel leading off the one they’re in. The race into it.
Scarlett throws her pack down and scans the walls with he fingers. She digs into the stone. Sees something.
Oh my God. There’s something there!
I know! She digs and digs.  62.
Don’t wreck it.
Look!
What is it?
La Taupe does not like the vultures. La Taupe is right, on the wall is a SMALL INSCRIPTION OF VULTURE.
Winged vulture! She looks to George.
What was it?! “Winged vulture leads your way.”
“,..with brightest light, in darkest day.” She looks at the vulture up close.

“Winged vulture leads your way...” She follows the angle of the vulture’s beak across the wa until it hits a second wall. She digs around at the joint of the two walls. Sure enoug there’s a crease! SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s something here! George is there in a flash. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I think it’s a Ptolemaic hinge! It looks like a scarab embedded in the stone. She kneels and finds another one.
Really?! I’ve never seen one before.  63.
What’s a Ptolemaic hinge?
It’s how they sealed pharaohs' tombs in ancient Egypt. The hinges formed a kind of riddle almost like an ancient padlock. There are a series of moves you must get precisely correct.
Or what?
Or it’1ll fall on you and crush you. Or the ceiling would collapse, or something else awful that would probably kill you.
Jesus. She gets ready to give it a shot. The cataphiles cautious back away, just in case.
Wait! What are you doing?! Giving it the old college try?!
You have a better idea?
Yeah. Go home. Not get crushed and die. She smiles at him.
Okay, you do that, but I’m going to take a shot. He hesitates for a moment.
Against my better judgement, may I ask what your plan is? She opens her notebook...
What was the... on the tomb...  64.
“Underneath heaven’s reign...”
Heaven's reign. The celestial spheres! 8 planets. Except Uranus wasn’t discovered yet. 7 planets. She gets ready to pull the door.
Wait! Was this built before or after Copernicus?
Good point. Before.
So they still believed everything rotated around the Earth.
Which means, the Earth was not counted as a planet.
But the moon was. As was the sun.
So eight?
That’s my count. She slides the stone out to the seventh line. The ceiling rumbles as the weight resettles. They look at it. Seems okay.
What’s next?
Now we twist.
How far? Scarlett remembers the inscription out loud.
.-. “atop this pair'ed fate.”  65.
Pair... twins?

Twins! Of course, Gemini! According to the Egyptian calendar, Gemini would fall at three o’clock on a dial. Ready? George nods nervously. Papillon backs up. She twists the stone and it spirals outward as it moves. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Okay... okay... Gemini. She stops. The ceiling rumbles a bit again. Sand pours fr beside the stone as the rumbling intensifies.
I don’t like this game. The stone slides toward them.
Back up! La Taupe runs for the door.
What’s happening?
I don’t know. The stone drops out of place and lands on the floor with thud, revealing:
PERSON TO SQUEEZE THROUGH. La Taupe quickly crowds in to look. Scarlett shines a light into it, but it doesn’t reveal mu beyond a single rat scurrying out of sight.
No way I’m crawling through that.
Ditto.  66.
This is probably the first time someone has shined a light in that space in over 500 years.
A new tunnel.
The treasure.

Give me a boost. Papillon places his knee so she can use it to climb throu Scarlett climbs into the hole. She barely squeezes through, but keeps going and going an going. Her breathing gets labored as she pulls her way through. From the door side of the hole, we see her clear the othe end. She turns back to face the others.
George. You gotta see this. George thinks it over.
What is it?
George. Seriously. Come here. George really doesn’t want to do this.
Shit. He climbs into the hole and struggles through it to join Scarlett.
George comes out the other side and rolls out of the hole He stands to find: A tomb, atop which is laid A CORPSE, CLEARLY SEVERAL CENTURIES OLD, PERFECTLY PRESERVED.  67.
Hello?
He’s dead.
How is he not rotting?
I don’t know. The headstone is marked “C.R. Of R.C.”
C.R. Of R.C.
Christian Rosenkreuz of the Rosy Cross.
No! The founder of the Rosecrucians?! Holy shit. (catches his language, apologizes to the corpse) Sorry. (to Scarlett) His tomb was found by Rosicrucians in the 1600s. Along with the secrets of...
..-alchemy which reignited its interest for the next 200 years. George notes another inscription.
“VITRIOL.” What’s that?
The motto of alchemy. It stands for: “Visita Interiora Terrae Rectificando Invenies Occultum Lapidem.”
(translates) “Visit the Interior Parts of the Earth; by Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone.” The others have been filing in.  68.
Is he dead?
Yes. For 700 years.
Creepy. The middle of the chamber is filled with water, making it echo creepily in the space.
There’s more. “Visit the interior parts of the earth.” He’s saying to go deeper.
We're kind of interior already, don’t you think?
What was the... “Winged vulture leads your way. In brightest light in darkest day.” Scarlett sees something in the water. Looks closer. She turns off her flashlight.
Turn off your flashlights. Everyone!
With a dead body in here? No way.

Just do it. They all do so, Benji having the hardest time submitting darkness. But as Benji clicks off the onboard light, submerging the group in total darkness, we see what Scarlett saw: traces light deep in the water. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Where’s that light coming from if that’s a wall? Papillon flips his flashlight on, pokes at the wall. Scar drops herself down into the water.  69. The camera travels with Scarlett under the water as her h pokes at the stone deep in the water. She rises back up, now soaking wet. SCARLETT (CONT’D) There’s a loose stone. Someone help me. Papillon jumps in with her. The two drop into the water. Again the camera drops in with them as they pull against large stone. They dislodge it and pull it away from the w revealing more light. Scarlett just comes up long enough to take a breath, and her backpack off. She then dives back down into the murky brown water, push herself through the opening and swims into a brighter lig She clears the wall and pulls herself up on the other sid
As she rises up, it is obvious that THIS IS THE PLACE THE BEEN SEARCHING FOR.

Ooh! There are lit torches on the walls. Gold all around them. The floors, walls and ceiling are lined in alchemical sym and ancient Egyptian symbology. Eerie and magical at the time. Scarlett laughs, still not believing her eyes. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I found it, Dad. You were right. George comes up out of the water. He sees what she does.
Oh my God.
Yeah. She can’t help but get choked up.
It’s real.  70.
It’s real. George takes a seat.
I think we’re gonna need a bigger bag. La Taupe rises out of the water.
Mon dieu. He takes a gold coin. Shoves it in his pocket. And anothe and another.
I’m quitting my job!!! There is a big pile of coins that seem wedged between the floor and ceiling. La Taupe pulls at them, trying to disl them. Souxie and Zed appear, and also pocket coins.
How are these torches lit?
The Philosopher’s Stone can fuel a lamp for eternity.
So where is it? The stone.
“The brightest light in darkest day.”
The sun. She smiles. She points at an ancient-Egyptian-inspired painting of a god stretched across the floor of the chamber.

In ancient Egypt, the earth god and the sky goddess... She points to the ceiling, where a goddess, lined with st hangs.  71. SCARLETT (CONT’D) «+. were madly in love. But when they had they first child, the sun, he became so jealous of their affections that he pushed them apart from each other, leaving them only able to touch by the palms of their hands and the soles of their feet. She points now to a winged stone painted between the two gods.

Every morning the sky gives birth to the sun and every evening she swallows him back up. She takes out a knife and makes her way to the winged sto With all the opulence surrounding them, this one chalky purple stone would hardly be worth noting.
That’s it? It looks so ordinary. Scarlett smiles.

What better place to hide the most valuable stone ever known, than beside riches you could never miss. Papillon and La Taupe furiously bag piles of coins and ot treasures. Scarlett uses her knife to edge the stone out of its plac and carefully places it in a cloth satchel she brought specifically for this.

You wouldn’t believe the trouble I went through to find you. She tucks the stone into a waterproof pocket. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Okay, let’s get out of here. They turn around. La Taupe and Papillon pull furiously at mound of coins wedged so tightly between floor and ceilin it takes two of them to pull the coins free.  72. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Wait! Is that... She looks at the ceiling. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Load bearing?!! As the coins break free, THE CEILING CRACKS. Chunks drop around them.
Run! They all struggle get up and run like mad as THE CEILING CRUMBLES OVER THEM.

A huge echoing crash as THE CEILING DROPS. They race away from it, barely escaping being crushed under its weight. Brown dust completely envelops them, blotting out all the light in the room. Nothing but darkness. It’s suddenly ve quiet, still. Some coughing and struggling. Someone is crying, in pain. Scarlett’s voice is the first to pierce the darkness.
Is everyone okay?
Yeah. I think I’m okay.
Oui.
I am. Pause.
Papillon? Souxie? Nothing.
Papillon?! Souxie?! As the dust begins to settle, traces of their head lamps through the darkness.  73. The sounds of whimpering, muffled.
I hear someone! The air clears a bit more. A hand sticks out of the rubbl George is on it in a second, pulling stones off and tossi them aside. Souxie breaks through the rubble. Coughing. In pain.
Are you okay?
Papillon! George pulls her out of the rubble. She’s banged up and bruised, has a nasty cut on her arm, but she’s okay.
Papillon, if you’re goofing around... Nothing. Scarlett sifts back into the rubble. No sign of Papillon. Zed drops under the water and looks. Nothing.
Jesus. Papillon?! Nothing. George turns on La Taupe.
You asshole! You could have killed us all! George goes after Taupe, but Scarlett and Zed intervene.
Stop! We shouldn’t disrupt the space any more than we already have.
Is Papillon... dead?
We're all dead! That was the only way out!  74. He’s right. They are all enclosed in a small room with no exit.
Ay! Souxie’s arm is hurting her.
Where’s the first aid kit? We need to clean up that cut. They all look around.
The packs are buried.
Water? Food? They all look at each other. Nothing.
Spare batteries? Nope.
Once the headlamps go out...
Let’s start conserving. George turns his off, dropping the light of the space dow considerably. Benji does the same. George pokes around at the rubble, looking for a way out.
Maybe we could dig our way out.
With what? Your hands?
He’s right. This chamber was created by master builders. If they wanted to trap the unworthy, we’re trapped.
So what, we just sit here and wait for the air to run out?! (MORE )

We're all just cool hanging out waiting to die?! George looks around the room. They’re all trying to wrap their heads around the situation. Terrified. Scarlett looks closer at the structure around them.
Those lamps are Freemason by design.
So?

Freemasons never built something like this without a back door, just in case it collapsed on them. She keeps inspecting their surroundings. She takes a rock taps on the walls, listening for something that sounds hollow. Nothing. The floor and the ceiling seem to be painted and inscribe the same exact way, almost as if there were a mirror runn the length of the floor. SCARLETT (CONT’D) “As above, so below.” That phrase is the key to all magic. She continues to search for something that doesn’t fit wh continuing her thought.

It means, basically, what is within me is outside of me. What is on earth is in heaven. As I am, so are my cells, so are my atoms. Basically, what I believe the world to be, so it is. She sees something. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Look. She points to a rectangle inscribed on the ceiling that’s covered in alchemical symbols.
What is it?
The Porta Alchemica. The door to the mystical.
So it’s a door?! George grabs a rock and gets ready to chisel at it.
No! Look. That symbol of the door on the ceiling is the only thing not replicated on the floor. 76. Scarlett shines the light from the rectangle on the ceili down to the floor directly beneath it.
So?
“Bs above, so below.”
So if...
If they painted a door on the ceiling...
Then there would be a door on the floor too.

There is nothing below us. This is the bottom of the Catacombs. Scarlett takes the rock from George. She kneels down in t water in the gutter at the bottom of the chamber. She hit with the rock. Hits it again. And again. CRACK. She looks around at the others as the water drains of the bottom.
(to La Taupe) That water must be going somewhere. Scarlett doubles her efforts, hitting the shit out of the rock until.
The floor of the gutter beneath her gives. She rushes awa from it as the stones beneath her feet give way and disap off into nothingness.
This isn’t catacombs. Look at the edges. This wasn’t made by man. Who knows where this could lead.
Whatever it is, it’s a possible way out.

Oh, going deeper. Scarlett picks a rope and lowers herself down into the ch The descent is eerie, dark. They watch as she goes. And goes. And goes. Scarlett stops. She takes a flashlight and shines it arou looking at what’s in front of her.
There’s a passage down here!

Scarlett places her feet on the ground and looks up to fi A very small opening with a large stone arch over it. It looks ancient. Very, very ancient. The others file in behind her. Something about this space makes them all feel uneasy. Scarlett notes the ancient inscriptions on the arch.
Can you read that? What does it say? George dusts it off to get a better look. Reads it quietl himself, thinking through the meaning.
“Abandon all hope, ye who enter here.” Scarlett understands.  78.
Oh.
What.
According to mythology, that’s the inscription over the gates of hell.
I’m not going in there.
(to La Taupe) I thought you didn’t believe in any of this.

I don’t. La Taupe is deeply unnerved by the idea of crossing this threshold, but there truly is no other choice. The entrance is so small, so low to the ground that they’ have to slide through it one at a time. Scarlett notes it.
“And they shall be made to crawl on their bellies into the kingdom of darkness.”
Yeah. That occurred to me too.
I don’t like this. They prepare themselves to cross through. Scarlett goes for it. She slides her pack through and fol closely behind it.

Scarlett stands up in the next room to find: IT’S EXACTLY THE SAME AS THE ALCHEMIST CHAMBER THAT COLLA ON THEM. Same artwork on the ceiling. Same gold. Same mis Philosopher’s Stone. Though this room is still intact.  79. It sounds a bit different this side of the threshold. Lik faint throbbing drone in the background. George stands up behind Scarlett, looks around.
Whoa. She looks at him.
Yeah.
It’s exactly the same. Scarlett points at one of the painted gods on the wall.

Not exactly. They’re facing the other direction. She's right. This room looks like THE MIRROR IMAGE of the earlier Alchemist Chamber that collapsed on them. La Taupe turns back, considering his options. He drops to knees, and digs around furiously looking for something. T follow his eyes to find what’s freaking him out - THE SMA

head_text.subj: ENTRANCE THEY CRAWLED THROUGH SEEMS TO HAVE DISAPPEARED

text: What happened to the entrance? THE SMALL ENTRANCE IS GONE. There is no retreat. La Taupe stands and looks at them, very seriously. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Are we dead? They all contemplate this for a moment.
No. Scarlett sees the fear rising in her group.
We should keep moving. She takes a deep breath and lunges underwater, pushing he way under the rock to the other side.  80.

Scarlett comes up on the other side. A mirror image of th rose chamber. The same tomb. THIS TIME WITH A ROTTEN CORP ATOP IT. Scarlett looks around nervously. The others join her, one at a time. George looks past Scarlett.

(calling out) Hello? She spins to find. A FIGURE STANDING AT THE FAR END OF THE ROOM. In the dark it’s hard to see more than a faint shape. George's voice echoes through the long chamber. No reaction. Nothing. They all look at each other, not sure what to do.
Can you hear me? Nothing. The figure moves a little, muttering quietly to himself - like a man possessed.
(quiet) Maybe he knows a way out. (calling out) Do you know a way out? Nothing. The figure just keeps muttering to himself. Scarlett takes a step toward him. And another.
What are you doing?
We have to pass him. She's right. The hole that leads beyond is just behind th figure.  81. They inch forward.
They all freeze as the figure moves, repetitious, erratic like someone with severe mental illness. The figure takes another step forward, stepping into the light:
Papillon?! Nothing. No reaction. Souxie moves to the front of the pack. Old friends with Papillon.
Papillon. Et-tu bien? No reaction.
How’d you get here? Nothing. Souxie moves closer. They all follow her.
Careful, Souxie. Souxie gets closer.
Et-tu bien, Papillon? As they get closer, they can hear pieces of what he’s muttering. He doesn’t seem to see any of them.
Papillon. She inches closer and closer. She reaches out to touch hi shoulder.

head_text.subj: IN A FLASH, PAPILLON VICIOUSLY ATTACKS SOUXIE, CRASHING H

text: RIGHT THROUGH THE CAMERA (which falls into the water, fra the rest of the incident from an odd angle) AND SLAMMING

head_text.subj: HEAD AGAINST THE FLOOR, OVER AND OVER, SCREECHING

text: EVERYONE RUSHES TO SOUXIE’S DEFENSE, fighting to rip Papi off her. PAPILLON FALLS AWAY INTO THE DARKNESS. Benji picks the camera up off the floor and spins it to t to cast light on Papillon.
Over there! Nothing.
Where’d he go?
What the fuck?! Scarlett tends to Souxie, who is unconscious and bleeding from the face and mouth.
We need to get her out of here! We need to get her help!
Papillon?! Everyone is shaken up.
Grab her legs!

Okay. Okay. La Taupe lost his mask in the struggle, revealing TERRIBL BURN SCARS ON HALF HIS FACE. He helps George and Scarlett lift Souxie. They rush her to the small opening at the end of the cham exactly the same as the one behind the Ptolemaic hinged d

Give me the rope.  83. Zed grabs the rope and hands it to Scarlett. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Tie her feet and lift her into the hole once I get through. Scarlett squeezes through, nothing but her feet visible t the others.

It’s tight in the tunnel with Scarlett. Her breathing lab and nervous. As she nears the end, she hears something in the next roo She stops. Listens. What is it? Someone’s voice? She’s scared, but this isn’t the place to stop. She climbs forw She approaches the end of the hole very slowly, worried a what she might find in the next room. She suddenly pushes her way out.

Splash! She falls out the other side into the water. She jumps to feet, and scans the room looking for anyone who might be there. She doesn’t see anyone. She looks at her arms. Blood? She dips her hand in the wa looks at it. Dark red. She looks around the room again.
Okay. Send Souxie.
I’m coming first. So I can help pull. George climbs through. He drops into the water beside Scarlett. He too notes the “water.”
Is this blood?  84.
I don’t know. George tastes the liquid off his fingers.
It tastes like blood. I think...
(very serious) Let's just keep going.
Yeah. George and Scarlett pull Souxie through the tunnel while keeping an eye behind themselves, just in case.
They all rush onward, sticking close together, on edge. They arrive at a hole in the ground. Much like the one th descended earlier.
Great. Everything is the mirror image of what we’ve already done, but somehow it keeps going deeper.
How deep will this take us? Zed finishes lowering his rope. He does the math in his h
Another 100 meters.
Making it... 1000 feet beneath the earth’s surface. That’s pretty deep.
Deeper than the Eiffel Tower is high.
Yeah, I get it.  85.
Scarlett and George get to the bottom. Look left to find bone chamber. Scarlett steps back into the chimney and helps spot the lowering of Souxie. Only Benji remains above.
Scarlett?
Do you hear that?
What?
Scarlett?
Is that Benji?
(shaken) I don’t think so. Scarlett steps into the chimney. Calls to Benji. SCARLETT (CONT’D) You okay up there Benji?

Benji kneels, alone up top, tense, lowering Souxie down. camera sits on the ground beside him, cropping him strang Is something moving in the shadows behind him? He hears a faint cry. A baby? He uses the camera’s onboard light to look around. Nothin He lowers Souxie down a little further. Scarlett calls up him.
You okay? He hears something. Is someone lurking in the shadows?
Is someone up here?  86. Nothing.
Benji? You okay? He hears else. Looks. Nothing. He calls down to Scarlett.
Yeah. He hears something directly behind him and spins to find:

head_text.subj: A WOMAN IN A BLOODY NIGHTGOWN HOLDING A DEAD INFANT. HER

text: Aah! Benji jumps away from her, dropping the line and slipping the edge of the chute.
Souxie drops the last ten feet, landing with a thud.
Oh! Benji, you just...
They all spin to find BENJI BEHIND THEM, DEAD FROM A FALL DOWN THE CHIMNEY CHUTE. They look up the chimney chute. Is someone looking down a them? George checks Benji’s vitals. Shakes his head. Dead.
What just happened?!
I don’t know. Scarlett bends down and strokes Benji’s hair tenderly. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I’m so sorry, Benji.
We should keep moving. George snaps to.  87.
Hand me the camera. We might need the onboard light. Zed grabs it, hands it to George.

They shuffle over the bones in the chamber as fast as the can, each struggling against the fear of getting trapped here. George sees something under the bones. He shines a light it to get a better look. Underneath the bones is a gutter full of water, in which YOUNG MAN, struggles to get to the surface of the water t breathe.
Danny! Danny! The Young Man pushes against the bones, but George’s weig on top of them makes it impossible for the Young Man to breathe.
Get off the bones! He’s drowning down there! Everyone get off the bones! The Young Man seems to keep pace with George as he desperately tries to get out of the way.
This is tapping a deep nerve in George. He gets to the end of the bone chamber and checks back to find the Young Man gone. George covers his mouth and takes a few beats. Scarlett approaches him.
It was so real.
You okay?
Why... Why would... he be here?  88.

It’s not him. I think this place knows our pain and is using it against us. In the distance, SOMEONE SCREAMS MERCILESSLY - and not th kind of scream you hear in movies, the kind you hear in a at 4 in the morning. They all move very close together, getting more and more unnerved.

The screams become more and more present as the gang approaches. Seems like it’s coming from mushroom alley. The light in the corridor looks different too. As if lit firelight. They turn the corner to find:

head_text.subj: A CAR, IN FLAMES IN THE MIDDLE OF MUSHROOM ALLEY, A SMALL
FAMILY INSIDE THE CAR, SCREAMING MERCILESSLY, REACHING FO

text: La Taupe obviously knows what this is.
La Taupe races to the car, trying to help the people. Scarlett and George try to pull him away.

IN A FLASH, the BURNING MAN catches hold of one of La Tau legs. La Taupe struggles against the man, losing his shoe socks, pants in the struggle. LA TAUPE (CONT’D) Help me! Help me! George and Scarlett grab La Taupe’s arms and try to pull free, but it’s no use.  89. CRACK! The ground beneath the car seems to be cracking.

head_text.subj: THE BURNING CAR COLLAPSES INTO THE GROUND AS THE BURNING
GRABS LA TAUPE BY THE HAIR.

text: The ground swallows up the burning car and La Taupe, but ground closes at La Taupe’s knees, leaving La Taupe’s low legs sticking out of the ground, flailing in pain as the sounds of his singeing flesh and agonized screams below. Everyone rushes to his side, trying in vain to pull him b out of the ground. His flesh burns them to the touch. George nudges Scarlett, points. A figure hovers in the shadows at the edge of the corridor they came from. They hurry through the room, to the next hallway. Scarlett hears something.
Music. Sure enough. They hear music in the next room. Similar to electronic music the ravers played earlier.
They might know a way out. Scarlett leads George and Zed (who still carry Souxie) in the music to find:

The cataphile party, but it’s very different now. Through strobing lights, the ravers seem to scream inaudibly, writhing in pain, while BRUTALLY DEVOURING EACH OTHER. The music is different too. It’s full of cattle screams, grinding cacophonous noises, awful. Our gang turns off all lights and hustles through the hel sight as fast as they can. Suddenly, THE ONBOARD LIGHT ON THE CAMERA FLIPS ON,

head_text.subj: ILLUMINATING THE RAVERS AND THEY ARE ALL FUCKED UP

text: BLEEDING, MOUTHS SCREAMING. Horrific. The camera shakes. George spins around to find a raver desperately trying to take refuge behind him. George push away from the raver, as another one grabs him.  90. George hits him with the lens of the camera, but the rave keep coming. In the struggle, George loses his grip on Souxie.

head_text.subj: THE RAVERS SUDDENLY SWARM SOUXIE, RIPPING HER TO PIECES I

text: George jumps back from the mayhem, but loses his footing. A Raver drops onto George, trying viciously to rip into h George fights like mad to keep the Raver at bay, and even gets back to his feet as: ANOTHER RAVER RIPS A HUGE BITE OUT OF GEORGE’S NECK, shoo blood into the air. George drops to his knees, bleeding uncontrollably. Scarlett and Zed grab George’s arms and pull him into the next room. In the confusion, Benji’s camera strap has twi around George’s arm. The camera slides with them as he’s pulled into the next room.
The cinema’s screen now shows a “remixed” version of the silent film “Haxan - Witchcraft Through the Ages.” It’s bizarre, upsetting, creepy. Scarlett tries desperately to stop George’s bleeding neck

No! No! Nothing is working. SCARLETT (CONT’D) (to Zed) Come here! Put your hand here! Keep pressure! She rips into her bag. Pulls out the Philosopher’s Stone. She crumbles some of it off, rubs it into his wound. Watches. Nothing. SCARLETT (CONT’D) It doesn't work?! George mutters something.  She She She She Zed She She gl. SCARLETT (CONT’D) What? What was that?
(barely audible) “VITRIOL.”
gets it.
“Visit the Interior Parts of the Earth; by Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone." looks at George.

This isn’t the right stone. I have to rectify the taking of it. Only through putting it back will I find the real hidden stone. stands, looks around the dark, creepy chamber. SCARLETT (CONT’D) Oh fuck. contemplates it. SCARLETT (CONT’D) I’m going back. thinks he’s surely not understanding this right.
We must keep moving forward.

We’re more than half a mile underground. By the time you and I lift him out of here, he’1l be dead. looks over her gear, preparing herself. SCARLETT (CONT’D) And I’m not going to let that happen. runs back toward the rave room.  92. Note: The following sequence of Scarlett on her own will filmed only by the GoPro camera on her head.
