We will see arms and legs, hear her vocal and breathing reactions, bu won’t see her face. Instead, we'll experience the followi as she does.

Scarlett rushes into the room. The same music, the same lights. But this time there’s only one person there, danc alone amongst all the devoured flesh. Wearing a bull mask The bull mask moves, but doesn’t seem to be looking direc at her. She races to the next room.
Scarlett races through Mushroom Alley, nothing left but a small smouldering hole where La Taupe was swallowed up.
A FIGURE at the other end of the corridor stops Scarlett her tracks. Doesn’t look like Papillon. Older, heavier. A VOICE behind her.

Scarlett?! She spins around to find: HER FATHER RIGHT BEHIND HER! But something’s wrong with h His legs are like tree trunks grown into the floor. His a like brittle twigs with blood dripping off them. She jumps away from the sight...
Dad?! And bumps into something behind her. She spins to find:
Her bumping him has broken off one of his twigs, causing to howl in pain. SCARLETT’S FATHER No! What have you done?!  93.
What do you... She backs away from the sight, again bumping into somethi behind her. Her father is there too. SCARLETT’S FATHER You look just like my daughter.

It is me dad. SCARLETT’S FATHER No! You’re not her! She would never come here! Scarlett bumps something else, turns, her father is there too. SCARLETT’S FATHER (CONT’D) She would know. If she ever came here, there would be no way out. She’d be trapped here. Forever! She runs from the room, choking back sobs.

As she crosses the threshold into the next room, she bump into her father here too. SCARLETT’S FATHER Forever! Forever! Forever! Forever! His voice takes on a shrill screeching quality. Like a ba dream in which a loved one suddenly seems possessed. She keeps moving, but this place is really taking a toll her. Scarlett shuttles over the bones in the bone tunnel. Again, she sees her Father, in this room too. The multipl voices of her Father doubling, tripling, into a cacophony agony. SCARLETT’S FATHER (CONT’D) Ever! Ever! Ever! She clears the bones, and rushes into the next alcove nea the chimney chute, SOBBING AS SHE GOES. This is the lonel moment of her life.  94.

Her father continues to squall in the background as she m her way to the chimney chute. She can’t reach the opening well enough to get footing. She kicks off her shoes to get better traction, takes a running start, jumps up and grabs hold of the rock wall. struggles to make her way up the first couple feet. As she gets some height in the chimney chute without rope protect her, one false move would send her plummeting to death. Her foot slips and she almost drops. She takes a couple d breaths.
You can do this. Don’t think. Just keep going.
Scarlett gets to the top of the chimney chute, but gettin out of the circular hole isn’t easy. She has to carefully position herself as she inches herself to solid ground be the hole.

She rushes through the bloody water as fast as she can, trying to make up for lost time in the chimney chute. AN ARM REACHES UP FROM UNDER THE WATER AND GRABS HER LEG. She jumps at the feeling and pulls against it. Another ar Another. Arms reach up and grab her from every direction, pulling her under the bloody water.
Scarlett fights against the arms pulling her every which She plants a foot on a stone ledge and pushes with all he might.
Scarlett breaks through, now covered head to toe in blood She rips her way free of the grabbing arms.  95. She catches her breath, overwhelmed, freaked out.
Scarlett rushes through the small tight tunnel leading to Rose Chamber.
Scarlett lands in the Rose Tunnel, looks around, all safe She hurries through.
Ow! She looks down at her feet, illuminating:

head_text.subj: HEADS BURIED UP TO THEIR NOSES IN STONE, THEIR EYES

text: Other heads have nothing but their mouths showing and the try to bite anything passing. She does her best to avoid the faces, but sustains a seri of bites on the way, drawing blood. She dives into the water at the end to swim back into the alchemy chamber.
Scarlett enters the Alchemist Chamber. What once looked s opulent and breathtaking in its beauty, now looks evil, depressing, lonely.

“By Rectification Thou Shalt Find the Hidden Stone." She pulls the rock out as she scours the Egyptian images, looking for the eye of Ra she originally took the stone f She finds the eye. Lifts the stone. Too high. She slides rock into place and stands on it. She lifts the stone tow the eye of Ra. It clicks right into place. A perfect fit.

Okay, I’ve rectified. Now, where's...  96. The stone in its place, she drops her eyes, to find a mir right in front of her face. SCARLETT (CONT’D) -.. the hidden stone. Thoughts play across her face. She understands something hadn’t before.

George and Zed in the cinema. A GROUP OF 5 FIGURES ENTER FROM THE FAR END OF THE ROOM. quickly flips the camera’s onboard light off, dropping th room into near darkness, except for the projected images the silent movie. THE FIGURES MOVE AS IF IN SLOW MOTION, IRREGULAR, SILENT.

head_text.subj: THEY FLOW LIKE WAVES, TOGETHER IN IRREGULAR BURSTS, AS IF

text: (quiet) Shhh. George desperately tries to keep quiet despite his neck wound.
Scarlett races through the rose chamber where the rotting corpse’s body has been restored to it’s un-decayed state.

George and Zed hide. The Figures seem not to have noticed them. The camera lies right behind Zed and George just catching piece of the passing Figures, which makes the anticipatio almost unbearable. The Figures stop as they get close. One of them slowly tu his head, LOOKS RIGHT AT ZED AND GEORGE.  97.
Scarlett plants her feet and descends the Chimney Chute a fast as she can. She is focused, driven. She hits the ground at the bottom and runs for the bone chamber.
The Figures move closer and closer - still in their bizar slow motion - to George and Zed.
(quiet, to Zed) Go. Zed thinks about it for a moment.
